result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Hyke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs. Court costs are paid in full.
-----------------------

The Defendant is to serve sixty (60) days in the Walworth County Jail with Huber privileges to commence on or before October 24, 2022 @ 8:00 a.m. NOTE: The defendant is to report to jai on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Failure to comply will result in revocation of Huber for a period of five (5) days unless reinstated by the Court.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Jacob Hilton
Signed bond filed with the court.

CONTACT ONLY WITH MINOR B.B.B. dob 7-08-2019 PURSUANT TO FAMILY COURT ORDERS. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.M.F. dob 7-6-1987 or RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
